reviews.cmt: With no option to resume the tracking process after a force close, plus the app itself is so demanding when it comes to resources. Edit: recent updates are premium only! The app is getting ugly without trying to fix the main bugs

reviews.t: GPS adquisition and reliability is poor.
reviews.cmt: I run endomondo on a blackberry Torch 9800 and on the samsung galaxy S2. It sems a bit more reliable on the blackberry but sometimes it also fails to aquire gps signal on the BB. The samsung galaxy S2 is even worst, it almost never picks up the gps and if it does it drops it continously so when I get to my first mile it says I only have .7 miles, so until they fix the gps acuracy on the software I raye this below average. When it works is awesome though.

I love the design of this app - it\'s better than anything else of its type. However, on my device (Galaxy S3 running Cyanogenmod) the distance measurements are inaccurate and unreliable. It is not uncommon for the voice coach to tell me I ran a mile in 8:43 only to have the UI show me I ran that mile in 8:27. Also, it seems to lose its GPS signal every 3rd or 4th time I go out. All of my other location based apps work fine.

reviews.t: App hangs. Not starting at all
reviews.cmt: Never expected such a thing. What you guys are doing???

Endomondo can be buggy at times and the ads to upgrade are supremely annoying, but the app does what I need it to do, with a pretty straightforward interface, a very good GPS tracking system and some cool social features.

Endomondo is great for tracking workouts and all the related stats.  The training plan features for premium users are terrific. They have helped give me a customized training program to prepare for my 10k. Highly recommended app - I use it almost daily.
Sport watches can be expensive, but your smartphone beats them all in functionality with it\'s larger processor. This app is an essential part of my workouts. Superior to ANY sports watch.
Love the new update. I have been using this app every day since August and it just gets better and better!

I love this app. I love that it tracks mileage with GPS, gives calories burned, speed, how much to hydrate with. You can join challages. I love that you can log in online and manage your account, challanges and lots more.

Awesome app. Only wish I could raise the voice volume and not change music volume and add a cadence feature as well.\tAwesome app. Only wish I could raise the voice volume and not change music volume. Also the find friend feature is cool.
Good app. \304\260 really like it\'s give me an opportunity to track my result and etc.

reviews.t: Awful if you\'re already an athlete
reviews.cmt: I wanted something to give me the extra push to get me out the door and keep track of my training. The training plan got my paces completely wrong for the 5k multiple times. It also requires you to carry the device to record workouts. I prefer not to take my phone with me on runs so there\'s no compromise option for recording workouts. Bummer.
This app has it all for regular workout tracking. Some stats are unavailable for free version but the free part is quite informative. It works great and ia really accurate.
Task time audio feedback excellent.  Very accurate and reporting is great. Thanks endo people!

Works flawlessly with my Nexus 4, would give it 5 stars, but Endomondo will not take on the simple challenge of making the app compatible with the Pebble Smart watch like some of their competitors have done.
It needs to calculate the steps while walking or running like other applications do.
An awesome app! Keeps track of everything and is a good tool for making sure you stay on track with your training
Love integration with myfitnesspal and ability to play music in background. Only wish there was a way to program my intervals into app.
Best sports activity tracker app. Keep focused on power saving always...
After updating the app, it\'s not working anymore on my Galaxy Note 2 Android 4.1.2
